title: How pmsims works
text: pmsims estimates minimum sample size needed prediction model achieve adequate performance high probability (“assurance”). simulating datasets, fitting models, evaluating performance, tracing performance improves sample size grows — learning curve.

title: How pmsims works
text: Prediction models must trained enough data generalise beyond development sample. Inadequate sample sizes lead overfitting, unstable estimates, poor calibration. Traditional heuristics (e.g., 10 events per variable) ignore factors outcome prevalence, predictor strength, model complexity. Analytic formulae (e.g., pmsampsize) rely assumptions often fail modern models. Simulation-based approaches, like pmsims, overcome limitations explicitly generating data empirically assessing model behaviour across different training sizes.

title: How pmsims works
text: package operationalises simulation-based framework four modular steps:

title: How pmsims works
text: Specify: - Data generator — predictors outcomes simulated (continuous, binary, time--event) - Model function — model fitted (e.g. logistic regression, penalised regression, ML) - Metric function — one performance measures (AUC, calibration slope, etc.) also set target performance (e.g. AUC ≥ 0.75) assurance level (e.g. 80% probability performance ≥ target).

title: How pmsims works
text: data-generating process adjusted , large simulated datasets, chosen model reaches specified target performance. ensures simulations reflect realistic population characteristics.

title: How pmsims works
text: Synthetic datasets increasing size generated. sample size: - Fit model training data. - Evaluate performance independent test data. - Repeat across many simulated datasets. reduce computation, pmsims uses Gaussian Process (GP) surrogate modelling (via mlpwr) interpolate smooth learning curves limited number simulation points, focusing computational effort solution likely lie.

title: How pmsims works
text: learning curve used identify smallest n chosen quantile (e.g. 20th percentile) performance exceeds target value. gives required training size model expected achieve adequate performance least 80% cases.

title: How pmsims works
text: Two complementary criteria can applied: Mean-based — target achieved average across replications Assurance-based — target achieved replications (e.g., 80%) Assurance typically preferred study planning, since accounts model instability data variability.

title: How pmsims works
text: Simulations capture multiple sources randomness:

title: How pmsims works
text: pmsims separates data generation, model fitting, performance assessment, can adapted : - regression ML models - binary, continuous, survival outcomes - user-defined metrics - synthetic pilot-based data generation Planned extensions include: - hierarchical longitudinal data structures - missing data mechanisms - fairness subgroup stability analyses

title: How pmsims works

title: Minimum sample size for binary-outcome prediction models — simulate_binary
text: Two formulations supported. Mean-based: find smallest \(n\) expected model performance exceeds target \(M^*\), .e. $$\min_n \; \mathbb{E}_{D_n}\{ M \mid D_n \} \ge M^*.$$ Assurance-based: find smallest \(n\) probability performance exceeds \(M^*\) least \(\delta\) (e.g. 0.80), .e. $$\min_n \; \mathbb{P}_{D_n}\!\left( M \mid D_n \ge M^* \right) \ge \delta.$$ , \(M\) chosen performance metric probability/expectation repeated samples training data size \(n\). assurance criterion explicitly accounts variability across training sets; models higher variance typically require larger \(n\) satisfy .
